summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary interview of Correctional Officer Michael Thomas, who was on duty at the Metropolitan Correctional Center when Jeffrey Epstein died. The document includes attachments such as interview transcripts, assignment rosters, and count documentation from August 9-10, 2019.

keyFacts: Correctional Officer Michael Thomas was interviewed by DOJ OIG on July 15, 2021 regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death at MCC New York.
Thomas was represented by attorney Tova Noel and a legal intern from Richman Hill & Associates during the voluntary interview.
The investigation focuses on Epstein's death while in BOP custody at MCC New York in August 2019.
Attached documents include MCC assignment rosters and count documentation from August 9-10, 2019, critical dates surrounding Epstein's death.
The document is an official OIG investigative memorandum that contains neither recommendations nor conclusions.
